main event: A bright orange light that glowed intensely and appeared to be pulsating or rotating was observed in Midland, Texas on November 10, 1957.
interesting points: The object was approximately 4 to 5 feet in diameter and located about 50 to 60 feet off the ground.
The object remained stationary for approximately 4 to 5 minutes, then suddenly disappeared.
The object was of an unusual and unidentified nature.
The observer was with members of their family and close friends when they spotted the object.
The object appeared to emit a light, casting some illumination on the water below as it moved downward.
sighted object: A bright orange light that glowed intensely and appeared to be pulsating or rotating
